# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function that iterates over words and adds a new line each time the maximum `text_width` (default value of 10) would be exceeded:
```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        current_length = length(current_line) + length(word) + 1

        if current_length > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = string(word, "\n")
        else
            current_line *= string(word, " ")
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    join(lines, "")
end
```
An example usage:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Proin a elementum sapien." , 8)
"Lorem \nipsum\n dolor\nsit\namet,\n consectetur\nadipiscing\nelit.\n Proin\na\nelementum\nsapien."
```
